events.originalText: At least 91 people were killed and 190 others injured after a bomb hidden in a water tank exploded at a market in Hazara Town, Pakistan.
events.subtitle: February 2013 Quetta bombing
events.headline: Bomb explosion in Hazara Town, Pakistan kills 91 and injures 190

events.originalText: The Kyoto Protocol, an extension to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, entered into force.
events.subtitle: Kyoto Protocol
events.headline: Kyoto Protocol enters into force for climate change

events.originalText: Eleven people died in a train collision in Silver Spring, Maryland, leading to the creation of comprehensive U.S. federal rules for the design of passenger cars.
events.subtitle: 1996 Maryland train collision
events.headline: Train collision in Silver Spring, Maryland kills 11, leads to federal rules for passenger cars

events.originalText: The Lebanese Shia political and paramilitary organization Hezbollah released a manifesto describing its ideology and goals.
events.subtitle: Shia Islam
events.headline: Hezbollah releases manifesto on ideology and goals

events.originalText: The Ash Wednesday bushfires burned over half a million acres (over 2,000 km2) each in both South Australia and Victoria, killing 75 people and injuring 2,676 others.
events.subtitle: Ash Wednesday bushfires
events.headline: Ash Wednesday bushfires kill 75 and injure 2,676 in South Australia and Victoria

events.originalText: The DuSable Museum, the first museum dedicated to the study and conservation of African American history, culture, and art, was chartered.
events.subtitle: DuSable Black History Museum and Education Center
events.headline: DuSable Museum chartered as first African American history museum

events.originalText: Fidel Castro was sworn in as Prime Minister of Cuba, beginning his decades-long rule over the country.
events.subtitle: Fidel Castro
events.headline: Fidel Castro sworn in as Prime Minister of Cuba

events.originalText: The Popular Front, a coalition of left-wing parties, came to power in the Spanish general election, a factor in the outbreak of the Spanish Civil War five months later.
events.subtitle: Popular Front (Spain)
events.headline: Popular Front comes to power in Spanish general election

events.originalText: A landslide in Byblos revealed a sarcophagus in an underground tomb, later discovered to be part of a large Bronze Age necropolis.
events.subtitle: Byblos
events.headline: Landslide in Byblos reveals Bronze Age sarcophagus

events.originalText: The Council of Lithuania signed the Act of Independence (pictured), proclaiming the restoration of an independent Lithuania.
events.subtitle: Council of Lithuania
events.headline: Council of Lithuania signs Act of Independence, proclaims restoration of independent Lithuania

events.originalText: The Southern Cross expedition led by Carsten Borchgrevink achieved a new Farthest South of 78° 50'S, making the first landing at the Great Ice Barrier.
events.subtitle: Southern Cross Expedition
events.headline: Southern Cross expedition achieves new Farthest South

events.originalText: American Civil War: A Union victory at the Battle of Fort Donelson gave General Ulysses S. Grant the nickname "Unconditional Surrender".
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union victory at Battle of Fort Donelson gives General Ulysses S. Grant nickname

events.originalText: The French government passed a law setting the musical note A4 to a frequency of 435 hertz, in the first attempt to standardize concert pitch.
events.subtitle: A (musical note)
events.headline: French government standardizes concert pitch at 435 hertz

events.originalText: First Barbary War: Lieutenant Stephen Decatur led a U.S. Navy raid to destroy the captured USS Philadelphia in the harbor of Tripoli (depicted), denying her use to the Barbary States.
events.subtitle: First Barbary War
events.headline: Lieutenant Stephen Decatur leads raid to destroy captured USS Philadelphia in Tripoli harbor

events.originalText: Livonian Crusade: In the Battle of Karuse, the Grand Duchy of Lithuania achieved a decisive victory over the Livonian Order on the frozen surface of the Baltic Sea.
events.subtitle: Livonian Crusade
events.headline: Grand Duchy of Lithuania achieves victory over Livonian Order in Battle of Karuse

events.originalText: King Louis IX dispatched André de Longjumeau as the French ambassador to the Mongol Empire.
events.subtitle: Louis IX of France
events.headline: King Louis IX dispatches French ambassador to Mongol Empire
